F1.Definition: Academic student status for full-time study in academic or language programs in the U.S. certified by SEVP.
F1.Purpose: Academic or professional study at a university, college, high school, seminary, or language training program.
F1.Duration: Valid for the full duration of the program of study plus authorized practical training; stay until program end date indicated on Form I-20 and a standard grace period after completion.
F1.Stay After Program: Can remain up to a set grace period after program ends (usually 30â€“60 days).
F1.Key Feature: More flexibility and work options during and after study.

M1.Definition: Vocational student status for full-time training in nonacademic or vocational programs in the U.S. certified by SEVP.
M1.Purpose: Vocational, technical, or specialized nonacademic training.
M1.Duration: Valid for the time required to complete the program as listed on Form I-20 (typically up to 1 year); extensions possible in limited cases.
M1.Stay After Program: Limited or shorter grace period; must depart on completion unless an extension is approved.
M1.Program Changes: Very limited; often requires USCIS approval and new I-20.
M1.Transfer Between Schools: Strict limits (must be within first 6 months with USCIS approval).
M1.School Requirements: SEVP-certified vocational or technical training institution.
M1.Key Feature: For vocational training with limited work/transfer flexibility.
